intro: Mendoncia killipii, commonly known as the Killip's mendoncia, is a rare flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern California. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to the mild, Mediterranean climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
